definitions: To perform in a specified way in a particular situation or over a particular period.
To get along; to succeed or be in a particular condition.
To eat food; to be supplied with food.
To travel; to go on a journey.
examples: How did you fare on your exam?
The company is faring well despite the economic downturn.
They fared sumptuously at the banquet.
We fared forth into the wilderness.
